compilations.name: Cheat Meals To Have Before Your New Years Resolution Begins
Recreate A Whole McDonald's Meal At Home

compilations.description: Bored of eating the same old burgers? To excite your taste buds, we've compiled the perfect list of burger from all around the world. Travel to Mexico with the Chorizo burger and recreate the magic of Japan with the Shrimp Tempura burger. For us, the middle-eastern feta-stuffed falafel burgers was a definite winner!
compilations.name: Burgers From Around The World

compilations.description: There's no better feeling than sitting down to a juicy, indulgent burger with ALL the fixins.' And we all know the best burgers are messy masterpieces. Luckily, we've got a week's worth of juicy burger delights that'll keep you on your burger toes! From our mouthwatering mac 'n cheese burgers to a heart healthy salmon burger, full of zest, there's something here for every burger lover. Go right ahead: it's never a bad time to get your burger on!
compilations.name: Juicy Burgers For each Day of The Week

compilations.description: Did somebody say homemade burgers? They're a crowd favorite for good reason. Test out the yummy or the all-time-fave today. We bet you won't be able to pick your favourite, 'cause we've got buns for dayyyys!!
compilations.name: Homemade Burgers That Will Make You Forget About Takeout

compilations.description: Everyone loves fast food but sometimes, whether you're trying to be a little friendly to your body or your wallet, it's better to just recreate those favorite moments at home. Luckily, that's where we come in! Kick off your fast food extravaganza with these super spicy Curly Fries that'll put Arby's munchies to shame, and follow them up with this massive Homemade Burger that'll fill your soul and your stomach. Pick your favorites and tell us: which recipes are you chowing down on this weekend?
compilations.name: Recipes For When You Are Craving Fast Food

compilations.description: Everyone loves burgers (seriously), but we've figured out what the perfect burger is for your 20s, 30s and 40s! A cheese-stuffed burger bomb sounds about perfect for someone figuring out their 20s, a bacon ranch burger bowl for when you've figured it out a little, and finally a Japanese-style fried chicken burger when you just want to eat what you want! See? The burger never goes out of style - we know it, now you will too. You can thank us later.
compilations.name: Burgers To Make In Your 20s, 30s, 40s

compilations.description: There's never a bad time to meet The King! Well, the Burger King, that is. But you're trying to save money and we're here to help, so we're going to teach you how to make your favorite Burger King recipes at home! Start with the all-time favorite Big Massive Burger or enjoy a Spicy Veggie Masala Burger with your friends. After all, who doesn't love burgers?
compilations.name: Make Burger King Recipes At Home

compilations.description: There's only one requirement for a party in our book: burgers. We've got a bunch to change up your hosting game and wow your guests! To start it off, we suggest you plate up our Mac N Cheese Waffle Burgers and if that's not enough, test out our Cheese Stuffed Mushroom Burger. We bet you'll be left wanting more. Fire up your grills, the burgers await you!
compilations.name: These 7 Burgers Are A Total Game Changer

compilations.description: Ground beef is cheap, easy, nutritious, and straight-up delicious. If you love it like we do, try our mozzarella-packed meatball bake. Or these beef and cheese empanadas are perfect for on-the-go snacking. You can also serve a ground beef stuffed scalloped potato roll to impress the guests at your next party! See, the options go on and on.
compilations.name: Everything You Can Make From Ground Beef

compilations.description: To all the burger lovers out there, look no further! We have the most juicy and indulgent burger recipes you can share with your burger buddy! If you prefer keeping things simple, then check out our classic Homemade Massive Burger. And if you think you can take up a good challenge, then this Mac N Cheese Bun Burger will BLOW YOUR MIND. Say YES to this Burgermania to which even Inspector Clouseau was not immune!
compilations.name: Recipes To Share With Your Burger Buddy

compilations.description: Want to experience the exotic flavors from around the world but are too busy to travel? Here's the solution, why not bring your destination to your kitchen! Time to travel to The World's Culinary Melting Pot. These quick and delicious fast food recipes are greater than the sum of their parts and offer something unique. From the Big Massive Burger to the classic New York City Hot Dog, here are a few that fit the all-encompassing “American Dream”.
compilations.name: Bring American Fast Food To Your Kitchen

compilations.description: You're invited to a How I Met Your Mother watch party! These recipes will be the perfect fit, just like Barney's suits! Try Marshall’s pick for the best burger in New York, the Homemade Big Massive Burger, or make your own "accidental" Curly Fries. When life gives you a pineapple, don’t ask where it came from–just make
compilations.name: Host a How I Met Your Mother Watch Party!

compilations.description: When we think of fast food, our mouths begin to salivate and our stomachs get ready to enjoy a delicious and ever-filling meal. Fast food is something we all love, that sometimes it's just not possible to go out and buy, for whatever the reason may be. Well, have no fear; we are here. We have hand-picked our favorite fast food recipes just for you! From our famous Honey BBQ Chicken Wings to golden and crispy Air Fryer Fish & Chips , we have it all! So what are you waiting for? Dig in!
compilations.name: Fast Food You Can Make at Home!

description: This homemade big massive burger recipe is perfect for anyone looking to indulge in a delicious and satisfying meal. With juicy beef, melted cheese, and all the fixings, this burger is sure to hit the spot.

instructions.display_text: Roll half of the beef mince into a ball and pat it down until a finger thick, bigger than palm size patty. Repeat with remaining beef.
Fry both patties with salt and pepper for 2 and a half minutes a side. Add 1 cheese single to one of the patties.
Toast the burger buns on a dry pan on medium heat until one of the sides is golden brown.
Mix all the sauce ingredients and set aside.
Time to build this bad boy! Spread burger sauce on a bun, sprinkle diced onion, shredded lettuce, place the patty with cheese, place another slice of bun.
Then more sauce, more onion, shredded lettuce, gherkin slices, another patty, and the last slice of bun!
Dig in and get lovin’ it!
Nutrition  Calories: 1774 Fat: 131 grams  Carbs: 69 grams Fiber:  7 grams  Sugars: 17 grams  Protein: 74 grams
Enjoy!

name: Homemade Big Massive Burger

compilations.name: No-Fuss Dinners You Can Make With Canned Tuna

compilations.description: Is it dinner time, and all you can find is a can of tuna? Well don't you worry: we've got a bunch of tuna recipes that're quick, easy, tasty, and are perfect for a lazy day! Start with Tuna Linguine topped with Tomatoes, Olives And Capers or try a fancy Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll. Sit down to your favorite movie, pour yourself a drink, and settle in for a stay-at-home movie night that’s the best blend of comfort and culinary deliciousness.
compilations.name: Tuna Meals

compilations.description: Did somebody say homemade burgers? They're a crowd favorite for good reason. Test out the yummy or the all-time-fave today. We bet you won't be able to pick your favourite, 'cause we've got buns for dayyyys!!
compilations.name: Homemade Burgers That Will Make You Forget About Takeout

compilations.description: You need something refreshing at the end of a long week, and whether you like fish or chicken, we've got just what you need. Bring takeout to you with our crunchy Fried Chicken Strips, or usher in a taste of England with our Salt-and-Vinegar Battered Fish. Feeling like eating a bit of both? Look no further than our full-fledged taco night, featuring Shredded Chicken Tacos or some easy, classic Fish Tacos. So, are you #TeamChicken or #TeamFish?
compilations.name: Chicken Vs. Fish

compilations.description: There's never a bad time to meet The King! Well, the Burger King, that is. But you're trying to save money and we're here to help, so we're going to teach you how to make your favorite Burger King recipes at home! Start with the all-time favorite Big Massive Burger or enjoy a Spicy Veggie Masala Burger with your friends. After all, who doesn't love burgers?
compilations.name: Make Burger King Recipes At Home

description: These hearty burgers are made with canned tuna, breadcrumbs, and spices, then pan-fried until crispy and served on a bun with your favorite toppings.

instructions.display_text: Combine the tuna, olive oil, panko, parsley, chives, garlic, salt, pepper, paprika, and egg in a large bowl until evenly mixed.
Divide the mixture into 4 portions and form patties with your hands.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Place the patties in the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Serve on whole wheat buns with your preferred toppings.
Enjoy!

name: Tuna Burgers

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for cooking

compilations.name: 5 Fast Food Recipes You Can Make At Home
How To Host A Friendsgiving Under $50
6 Versatile Burger Recipes Fit For Every Type of Eater

compilations.description: Who says turkey is just for Thanksgiving? Make a fancy, loaded Turkey Roulade or have some fun with homemade turkey twizzlers! Have a wholesome Mozzarella-Stuffed Turkey Meatloaf for dinner. Or flip some spicy Southwestern-Style Turkey Burgers at your next outdoor party!
compilations.name: Dishes You Can Cook With Turkey

compilations.description: There's no better feeling than sitting down to a juicy, indulgent burger with ALL the fixins.' And we all know the best burgers are messy masterpieces. Luckily, we've got a week's worth of juicy burger delights that'll keep you on your burger toes! From our mouthwatering mac 'n cheese burgers to a heart healthy salmon burger, full of zest, there's something here for every burger lover. Go right ahead: it's never a bad time to get your burger on!
compilations.name: Juicy Burgers For each Day of The Week

compilations.description: Did somebody say homemade burgers? They're a crowd favorite for good reason. Test out the yummy or the all-time-fave today. We bet you won't be able to pick your favourite, 'cause we've got buns for dayyyys!!
compilations.name: Homemade Burgers That Will Make You Forget About Takeout

compilations.description: 'Tis the season to celebrate the most creative souls around – Virgos! We've handpicked recipes catered to your inner Virgo soul. Try your hand at the Blue Curacao "Swimming Pool" a vat of creative delight. If that's not enough, the zesty Southwestern Style Turkey Burger will give you that zing you've been looking for! So, what are you waiting for, Virgos? It's your time to shine.
compilations.name: Recipes That Virgos Will Keep Making

compilations.description: Craving fast food from the comfort of your couch? Take the homemade route! If you're a pizza lover, try our bite size Pizza Bombs. Want something with more of a kick? Try out our spicy and crispy Buffalo Wings. What are you waiting for? Let's get cooking!
compilations.name: Fast Food Lovers!

compilations.description: What's not to love about burgers? Whether at a BBQ cookout or for a quick weeknight meal, there's nothing more satisfying than a juicy burger, especially when it pushes the envelope like our grilled pineapple loaded Piña Colada burger or the decadent mac and cheese bun burger. You can also travel East with the Japanese-style Fried Chicken burger. And our feta-stuffed falafel burgers are a hit with vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Don't believe us? Try them for yourself.
compilations.name: Burger Recipes That Will Change Your Life

compilations.description: Are you team Chicken or Turkey? Can't decide? Well, who said you can't have them both? These mouth-watering recipes strike the perfect balance. Add a chicken touch to your lunch menu with our Slow Cooker Buffalo Chicken Chili. Then, for dinner, try a Thanksgiving-worthy Turkey Roulade. Bring on the birds!
compilations.name: Chicken Vs Turkey

compilations.description: Bland is boring! A little spice can elevate any meal. If you agree with that statement, then get your palate ready to reach new heights! Why don't you check out these recipes to spice up your day? From a spicy-chicken-pizza to spicy-korean-bbq-style-pork , these recipes are sure to get you smacking your lips for more!
compilations.name: Time To Spice It Up!

compilations.description: The antidote to the cold weather outside is some hot and spicy food to get you warmed up! Spicy Sesame Cauliflower will have you licking your fingers after every bite. Feeling super hungry? At the end of a long day, devour a Southwestern-Style Turkey Burger for a filling and spicy meal. These dishes will make you break a sweat, even on the coldest of days!
compilations.name: Hot and Spicy Recipes for Cold Weather

description: Fire up your taste buds with these Spicy Southwestern-Style Turkey Burgers! Packed with bold flavors and a kick of heat, these juicy patties will make your next cookout a fiesta to remember.

instructions.display_text: Place turkey, onion, jalapeño, and spices together in a large bowl and mix together until all the ingredients are incorporated.
Lightly wet your hands and use them to shape 4 circular patties about 4 inches (10 cm) in diameter.
Heat up about 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook burgers for 2 minutes on the first side, then flip, lower heat to low, and cook them for an additional 5-6 minutes. Top with pepper jack cheese during the last minute.
NOTE: The turkey burgers must be cooked through. Use a meat thermometer to check each patty for an internal temperature of at least 165˚F (75˚C) before removing from pan.
Assemble the burgers as desired with bun, chipotle mayonnaise,  lettuce, tomato, avocado, and preferred condiments.
Enjoy!

keywords: burger, fresh , hamburger, healthy, southwest, spicy, tasty, turkey
name: Spicy Southwestern-Style Turkey Burgers

compilations.name: 4 Ways To Spice Up Your Boring Veggie Burger

description: Bite into these scrumptious Black Bean Corn Burgers for a flavor fiesta in your mouth! Packed with protein and veggies, these patties are perfect for a guilt-free, meatless meal that'll leave you craving more.

instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, combine black beans, rice, corn, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, black pepper, and egg. Mash well with a potato masher until thoroughly combined. Add the bread crumbs and mix to incorporate.
Divide the mixture into 4 portions and shape into patties.

Heat a drizzle of canola oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the black bean patties and cook for 4–5 minutes, until golden brown on the bottoms, then flip, top each patty with a slice of pepper Jack, and cook for another 4–5 minutes, until the cheese is melted.
Place the patties on the toasted buns and top with tomato, red onion, avocado, and pico de gallo. Serve warm.
Enjoy!

keywords: , bean, black, burger, cauliflower, chickpea, corn, pizza, potato, sweet, vegetarian, veggie
name: Black Bean & Corn Burgers

components.raw_text: 1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed

compilations.description: Barbecues are an entire experience in themselves – from the drinks to the grill, they're filled with fun, summer memories that just keep bringing you joy. With these grilled BBQ recipes, that feeling never has to end! A Cheesy Camping Hot Dog will squash your hunger and stir your soul like nothing else. Oh, and don't forget to pair that with a glass of Grilled Lemonade! It sounds strange but it's refreshingly brilliant. Get those grills fired up – it's barbecue time!
compilations.name: Easy Recipes For BBQ season

compilations.description: There's never a bad time to meet The King! Well, the Burger King, that is. But you're trying to save money and we're here to help, so we're going to teach you how to make your favorite Burger King recipes at home! Start with the all-time favorite Big Massive Burger or enjoy a Spicy Veggie Masala Burger with your friends. After all, who doesn't love burgers?
compilations.name: Make Burger King Recipes At Home

compilations.description: To all the burger lovers out there, look no further! We have the most juicy and indulgent burger recipes you can share with your burger buddy! If you prefer keeping things simple, then check out our classic Homemade Massive Burger. And if you think you can take up a good challenge, then this Mac N Cheese Bun Burger will BLOW YOUR MIND. Say YES to this Burgermania to which even Inspector Clouseau was not immune!
compilations.name: Recipes To Share With Your Burger Buddy

description: Sink your teeth into this American Burger Juicy Lucy recipe! Two beef patties are formed into a "sandwich" with a gooey cheese filling, then grilled to perfection. Served on a pillowy bun with all the classic toppings, this burger is sure to become a staple at your cookouts.

instructions.display_text: Mix together the patty ingredients until evenly combined.
Flatten the beef into a thin layer, then place a chunk of cheddar inside, wrapping the beef completely around the cheddar. Form a patty with your hands.
Repeat with the remaining beef and cheese.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, then cook for 6 more minutes.
Assemble the burgers with the bun, bacon, tomato, and lettuce.
Enjoy!

keywords: 4 burgers from around the world, around the world, bfv12310, burgers, global, hamburgers
name: American Burger “Juicy Lucy”

components.raw_text: 2 ounces cheddar cheese, sliced into 3 square chunks
3 strips bacon, cooked and sliced in half

description: Bite into a vibrant and flavorful Carrot Chickpea Veggie Burger that's perfect for a guilt-free meal. This scrumptious patty is packed with wholesome ingredients and a delightful crunch, making it a must-try for veggie lovers!

instructions.display_text: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, oats, carrots, red onion, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and olive oil. Blend just until combined.
Add the lemon juice and blend again until well-combined.
Scoop out a handful of the mixture at a time and form into patties.
Heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Cook the patties for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
Assemble with your favorite burger toppings.
Enjoy!

keywords: burger, buzzfeed, carrot, chickpea, delicious, meatless, meatless monday, tasty, tasty_vegetarian, vegetarian, veggie, veggie burger
name: Carrot & Chickpea Veggie Burger

compilations.name: 4 Ways To Spice Up Your Boring Veggie Burger
Vegan Alternatives To Your Favorite Foods

compilations.description: Any time is pizza time: there's no question about that. But maybe you need a break from the Papa or the Hut and, well, so does your wallet. We're bringing the pizza party to your kitchen instead. Start your day with a Quinoa Pizza Burger or enjoy a Pizza Cordon Bleu as a mouthwatering evening snack. It's Italy reinvented: you in?
compilations.name: These Pizzas Are A Total Game Changer

compilations.description: Quinoa is one of those superfoods that we all want to love but don’t know how to cook. Of course, there is the basic power salad. But did you know that you can also make a pizza crust from quinoa? Or these quinoa pizza burgers that are great to make for your vegetarian guests or for meatless Mondays! We personally love to munch on the high-protein baked quinoa bites to keep our energy levels up through the day. And this one-pan southwestern chicken quinoa is insanely good and easy to make. Pick your fav!
compilations.name: The Best Dishes To Cook With Quinoa
What To Do With All That Quinoa

compilations.description: Eating healthy doesn't mean your food has to be bland and tasteless. Get your nutrients from the ultimate superfood, quinoa, with these specially curated recipes, starting with the Quinoa Pizza Burger; yes, you read that right, and boy, does it taste delicious! Or try Quinoa Rice Cakes with Mediterranean Chicken. Let’s go healthy this fall!
compilations.name: Tasty Quinoa Recipes!

description: Say hello to a healthier twist on pizza night with these Quinoa Pizza Burgers! Packed with protein and bursting with flavor, these burgers are a fun and nutritious way to satisfy your pizza cravings.

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C).
In a large bowl add the quinoa, beans, tomato, paste, and seasonings. Using a potato masher, mash the ingredients until thoroughly mixed together.
Take a quarter of quinoa-bean mixture and shape it into a patty using your hands. Repeat with the remaining mixture to create four patties.
Place the patties on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Top with mozzarella, and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Place the patties on buns, and top with tomato sauce, shredded Parmesan, and fresh basil.
Enjoy!

keywords: , bean, black, burger, cauliflower, chickpea, corn, pizza, potato, sweet, vegetarian, veggie
name: Quinoa Pizza Burgers

components.raw_text: 1 15-ounce can pinto beans, drained and rinsed

compilations.name: 5 Fish Recipes That Are Easy To Catch (And Make!)
5 Unique Recipes Burger Lovers Cannot Resist

From our mouthwatering mac 'n cheese burgers to a heart healthy salmon burger, full of zest, there's something here for every burger lover. Go right ahead: it's never a bad time to get your burger on!
compilations.name: Juicy Burgers For each Day of The Week

compilations.description: If you're pescatarian or trying to eat more seafood, you can never have enough fish-centric dinners. High on flavor and nutrients, these dishes won't disappoint. Pull out all the stops with our Salmon Wellington. Or for a more casual meal, throw together these lip-smacking fish tacos. Craving something creative? These teriyaki salmon bites will blow your mind.
compilations.name: Recipes For Pescatarians

compilations.description: Let's face it: we all love food. What we don't like, though? Tedious and over-complicated recipes that make you throw your hands up in frustration and pull up your UberEats app as quickly as possible. Well look no further and try out these recipes that are set to make your week easy, simple, and oh-so-delicious!
compilations.name: Simplify Your Week With These Tasty Recipes

compilations.description: Bake, grill or simply fry; you can have fish just the way you like. Try the very Easy Fish Tacos or the fancy Salmon Wellington. Tuna, Cod or Salmon, we've got it all!
compilations.name: Flavorful Fish Recipes

compilations.description: Fish is a great source of essential nutrients and great for your over all health! Other than it's helpful properties, it is also not that complicated to cook! We have some great fish recipes for you today! And so we have dedicated this video to all the fish lovers out there! From Teriyaki Salmon Bites to a delicious and easy Zesty Salmon Burgers, we have it all and more! Keep in mind, there are plenty of fish in the sea!
compilations.name: There’s Plenty of Fish In The Sea

description: Bite into these Easy Zesty Salmon Burgers for a scrumptious seafood twist on the classic burger. Packed with flavor and ready in a snap, these burgers will become your new go-to for a quick and satisfying meal.

instructions.display_text: In a small bowl, combine yogurt, spicy dijon, dill, chives, and honey. Set aside.
Cut salmon into ½ inch (1¼ cm) cubes and transfer to a food processor.
Pulse 5 times.
Add onion, dill, horseradish, honey, salt, and pepper and pulse a few more times to combine.
Form mixture into 4 patties.
Drizzle small amount of olive oil into frying pan and heat pan to medium-high.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes until browned. Flip and cook another 3-4 minutes until browned.
Serve on your favorite multi-grain bread with yogurt dill sauce.
Enjoy!

keywords: burger, fish, flavorful, healthy, lean, low-calorie, mouthwatering, omega-3 fatty acids, protein, salmon, vitamin b , zesty
name: Easy Zesty Salmon Burgers

instructions.display_text: Make the Frank’s® Red Hot lime crema: In a small bowl, whisk together the sour cream, Frank’s® Red Hot Sauce, lime juice and zest, and salt. Set aside. Crema can be made up to a week in advance, stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator

In a large bowl, combine the ground chicken, fresno chiles, Frank’s RedHot® Sauce, salt, garlic powder, and onion powder and mix gently with your hands until just combined. Divide the mixture into 4 even portions, then shape into 4-inch (10 cm) patties using wet hands to make it easier to shape.

Heat a 12-inch (30 cm) cast iron skillet over medium heat. When the skillet is hot, add the canola oil. When the oil starts to shimmer, add the chicken patties and cook until the bottom is golden brown and the bottom ⅓ of the patty looks cooked with a white hue, about 5 minutes. Flip the patties and add a slice of pepper Jack cheese. Reduce heat to low and continue to cook until the internal temperature of the center of the patties reaches 165°F (75°C), about 5 more minutes .

Assemble the burgers: Spread Frank’s® Red Hot lime crema on both sides of each bun. Place a lettuce on each bottom bun, then top with the patties, avocado, and  pickled fresnos. Top with the top bun and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: ¼ cup red bell pepper, minced

compilations.name: 6 Delicious Burger Recipes You Need To Try Today

compilations.description: There's no better feeling than sitting down to a juicy, indulgent burger with ALL the fixins.' And we all know the best burgers are messy masterpieces. Luckily, we've got a week's worth of juicy burger delights that'll keep you on your burger toes! From our mouthwatering mac 'n cheese burgers to a heart healthy salmon burger, full of zest, there's something here for every burger lover. Bring takeout to you with our crunchy Fried Chicken Strips, or usher in a taste of England with our Salt-and-Vinegar Battered Fish. Feeling like eating a bit of both? Look no further than our full-fledged taco night, featuring Shredded Chicken Tacos or some easy, classic Fish Tacos. So, are you #TeamChicken or #TeamFish?
compilations.name: Chicken Vs. Fish

description: If you love both chicken parmesan and burgers, then you'll love these cheesy chicken parmesan burgers! They're packed with juicy chicken, savory marinara sauce, and melted mozzarella cheese, all on a brioche bun. Perfect for a weeknight dinner or weekend BBQ.

instructions.display_text: Stir bread crumbs, salt, and parmesan together in a bowl.
In a large bowl, mix together chicken, salt, pepper, oregano, basil, parsley, minced garlic, and parmesan cheese.
Grab a handful of the chicken mixture and pat it out flat in your palm.
Place a slice of mozzarella cheese in the middle and fold the chicken over the edges. Make sure the cheese is fully covered on both sides by the chicken mixture.
Cover the patty with the bread crumb mixture on both sides.
Cook patty in a pan over medium-high heat for 4 minutes on each side.
Place on a bun and garnish with marinara sauce and fresh basil.
Enjoy!

keywords: burger, cheesy, chicken, chicken parm, mozzarella, parmesan
name: Cheesy Chicken Parmesan Burgers

compilations.name: Mouth-Watering Slider Recipes to Serve Your Friends

compilations.description: Feeding the kids on a busy weeknight doesn't have to be a daunting task. Kick off the week with some Cheese-stuffed Sliders, or satisfy their sweet tooth with S'mores Cones. Put a twist on a plain ol' bowl of tomato soup with a Grilled Cheese Bowl or bring some imagination to dinner time with a Sleepy Rice Bear. You can make weeknights delicious with these recipes we've curated, just for you.
compilations.name: Weeknight Meals Kids Will Love

compilations.description: Everyone loves burgers (seriously), but we've figured out what the perfect burger is for your 20s, 30s and 40s! A cheese-stuffed burger bomb sounds about perfect for someone figuring out their 20s, a bacon ranch burger bowl for when you've figured it out a little, and finally a Japanese-style fried chicken burger when you just want to eat what you want! See? The burger never goes out of style - we know it, now you will too. You can thank us later.
compilations.name: Burgers To Make In Your 20s, 30s, 40s

compilations.description: Oh no, the same boring lunch again? Tuna salad, chips, and an apple: it's like you're living Groundhog Day 100 times over! Do you ever wish you had some exciting, something mouth-watering? How about lunches that'll get you excited for mid-day munchies? Look no further than this awesome lineup. With these superstar lunches, you'll never be bored with your meal ever again: we promise!
compilations.name: Wave Goodbye To A Boring Lunch!
compilations.thumbnail_alt_text: Wave Goodbye To A Boring Lunch!

compilations.description: Ever wondered why Jerry could not keep his hands off the cheese? Cheese is not only "Tasty" but tis' loved by all. Balance your sweet side with something savoury by trying out these cheesy recipes.. and see for yourself why Jerry kept coming back for more.  SAY YES TO CHEESE!
compilations.name: Cheese the Pain Away

description: These Cheese-Stuffed Sliders are the ultimate game day snack that will make your taste buds cheer. Juicy beef sliders are stuffed with gooey, melted cheese and topped with all the fixings to create the perfect bite-sized burger.

instructions.display_text: Add ground beef, salt, and pepper to a large bowl. Combine until the meat is evenly seasoned.
Roll into 16 meatballs and set aside.
Cut each cheddar cheese block into 8 cubes (totaling 16 cubes).
Press the cheddar cheese cube into the meatball and wrap the meat around it, completely covering the cheese.
Preheat a skillet on medium heat for 10 minutes. After preheated, carefully coat with a light layer of oil with a high smoke point (we used canola oil).

Add sliders to the pan, frying on the first side until the bottom is browned and crisp and the sides begin to brown (about 2-4 minutes, depending on the desired doneness). Flip and finish cooking on the other side.
Serve immediately on Hawaiian sweet rolls with your favorite burger garnishes. (We added Roma tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, and Sriracha mayo.)
Enjoy!

keywords: appetizers, apps, burger, cheddar, cheese, cheesy, cooking, easy, food, game day, party, recipe, sliders, stuffed, tasty
name: Cheese-Stuffed Burger Bombs

description: Bite into this juicy 30-minute burger that's perfect for a quick and satisfying meal. With a mouthwatering combination of flavors, this easy-to-make burger will have you saying "yum-o" in no time!

instructions.display_text: Make the pickled red onions: In a small pot, combine the water, apple cider vinegar, salt, sugar, peppercorns, and coriander seeds, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Turn off the heat and add the sliced onion, making sure they are fully submerged. Let cool to room temperature for 30 minutes before serving.
Make the Thousand Island Dressing: In a medium bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, ketchup, pickles, garlic, and vinegar.
In a large bowl, season the ground beef generously with salt and pepper. Use your hands to mix until evenly combined.
Divide the beef into 4 8-ounce portions and form into patties. Place on a cutting board. Use your thumb to press a divot into the center of each burger.
Heat the grapeseed oil in a cast iron or stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat until nearly smoking. Add the burger patties and cook for 3-4 minutes, without disturbing, until browned.
Use a spatula to flip the burgers over and place a slice of cheddar on each one. Cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the burgers are cooked through and cheese has melted.
Place on sesame buns and top with the pickled red onions, Thousand Island Dressing, tomato, and lettuce. Serve with French fries.
Enjoy!

keywords: 3 hour, 3 minute, 3-minute vs. 30-minute vs. 3-hour, 30 minute, alexis deboschnek, alvin zhou, ambition, burger, burgers, comparison, decadent, easy burger, fast, grill, hour, how to make, how to make burgers, instructions, minute, pub burger, quick, simple, smash burger, steak burger, the best burger, the perfect burger, time to cook, tutorial, versus, vs, vs., weeknight
name: 30-Minute Burger

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, to taste
4 leaves of Bibb lettuce, for serving

compilations.description: Bored of eating the same old burgers? To excite your taste buds, we've compiled the perfect list of burger from all around the world. Travel to Mexico with the Chorizo burger and recreate the magic of Japan with the Shrimp Tempura burger. For us, the middle-eastern feta-stuffed falafel burgers was a definite winner!
compilations.name: Burgers From Around The World

compilations.description: What's not to love about burgers? Whether at a BBQ cookout or for a quick weeknight meal, there's nothing more satisfying than a juicy burger, especially when it pushes the envelope like our grilled pineapple loaded Piña Colada burger or the decadent mac and cheese bun burger. You can also travel East with the Japanese-style Fried Chicken burger. And our feta-stuffed falafel burgers are a hit with vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Don't believe us? Try them for yourself.
compilations.name: Burger Recipes That Will Change Your Life

compilations.description: Contrary to popular belief, feta isn't just a salad topper (hello, haven't you been watching TikTok lately)? You can whip up some feta-loaded spanakopita or make some feta-stuffed falafel burgers to highlight this awesome cheese. You can also pair it with spinach and zucchini and stuff it in a quiche! Want to make everything better? Feta's your answer.
compilations.name: Add Feta Cheese To Everything

compilations.description: Falafel is one of our favorite Middle Eastern-inspired bites, and we've found so many different ways to enjoy it. For the innovators, air fry your falafel balls instead of deep frying them. You can also bake them, and believe us, they'll be just as decadent. And may we introduce you to falafel sliders? We promise, these recipes are going to have you fala-felling in love.
compilations.name: Falafel Snacks

description: These feta-stuffed falafel burgers are a tasty vegetarian alternative to traditional meat burgers. The falafel patties are filled with crumbled feta cheese and topped with crispy lettuce and tangy salsa for a fresh and flavorful meal.

instructions.display_text: Add all the burger ingredients, except for the feta, to a blender and blend until smooth. (Make sure your chickpeas are very dry first!)
Divide mixture into four balls, then make an indent in the middle.
Place a small block of feta in each indent and roll up again until the feta is completely covered.
Fry in sunflower oil for 5 minutes until brown on each side.
Add to a burger bun with lettuce, tomato, salsa, and coriander.
Enjoy!

name: Feta-Stuffed Falafel Burgers

compilations.description: Bored of eating the same old burgers? To excite your taste buds, we've compiled the perfect list of burger from all around the world. Travel to Mexico with the Chorizo burger and recreate the magic of Japan with the Shrimp Tempura burger. For us, the middle-eastern feta-stuffed falafel burgers was a definite winner!
compilations.name: Burgers From Around The World

compilations.description: There's never a bad time to meet The King! Well, the Burger King, that is. But you're trying to save money and we're here to help, so we're going to teach you how to make your favorite Burger King recipes at home! Start with the all-time favorite Big Massive Burger or enjoy a Spicy Veggie Masala Burger with your friends. After all, who doesn't love burgers?
compilations.name: Make Burger King Recipes At Home

description: Spice up your burger game with these Mexican Chorizo Burgers! These juicy beef patties are mixed with chorizo, topped with guacamole and pico de gallo, and served on a toasted bun. Perfect for your next barbecue or weeknight dinner.

instructions.display_text: Mix together the patty ingredients until combined.
Form the beef mixture into 3 round patties.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, and place a slice of manchego cheese on top.
Cook for 6 more minutes until the cheese is melted.
Assemble the burgers on the buns with guacamole, cotija, pico de gallo, and sour cream.
Enjoy!

keywords: 4 burgers from around the world, around the world, bfv12310, burgers, global, hamburgers
name: Mexican Chorizo Burger

description: Sink your teeth into a juicy burger that's bursting with flavors and colors. These beetroot feta burgers are a work of art, combining the earthy sweetness of beets with the tangy creaminess of feta.

instructions.display_text: To a large bowl, add the beetroot, sweet potato, salt, black pepper, garlic granules, smoked paprika, lemon zest, coriander, tahini, feta, eggs, and breadcrumbs. Mix until thoroughly combined. You should achieve a wet, sticky mixture that should just about come together when formed into a burger.
Next place a large frying pan over a low-medium heat and add around 1 cm (½ in) of oil. You need enough oil so the burgers are at least halfway covered with the oil when they are in the pan.
Once the oil is warm, cook the burgers for around 5 minutes per side or until cooked through and golden brown on the outside. Remove from the pan and drain excess oil on kitchen paper.
To prepare the tzatziki, add the Greek yoghurt, cucumber, garlic, mint, lemon juice, black pepper, and salt to a bowl and mix thoroughly. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Place your beetroot patty onto a burger bun, top with tzatziki and rocket salad.
Enjoy!

name: Beetroot & Feta Burgers

compilations.description: There's never a bad time to meet The King! Well, the Burger King, that is. But you're trying to save money and we're here to help, so we're going to teach you how to make your favorite Burger King recipes at home! Start with the all-time favorite Big Massive Burger or enjoy a Spicy Veggie Masala Burger with your friends. After all, who doesn't love burgers?
compilations.name: Make Burger King Recipes At Home

compilations.description: If you worship cheese like we do, then we have a treat for you. Our cheese-stuffed mushroom burger can compete with Shake Shack's best, and our cheesy burger dogs are not for the faint of heart. Oh, and did someone say broccoli cheddar chicken roll-ups? Bring us a plate, ASAP!
compilations.name: Cheese-Stuffed Foods That Will Change Your Life

description: Take your hot dog game to the next level with these cheese-stuffed burger dogs! The beef patties are shaped like hot dogs and stuffed with gooey cheese, then grilled to perfection. Topped with bacon, pickles, and ketchup, these are sure to be a hit at any cookout or tailgate party.

instructions.display_text: Slice the cheese into sticks (about the size of string cheese).

Season the ground beef with salt and pepper (or your favorite seasoning mix) and split it up into 5-6 palm-sized balls (you may want to do five and keep a bit of excess ground beef for an omelet or a slider the next day).
Flatten each ball out into a rectangle.
Place a cheese stick towards the bottom. Roll it up, making sure that the ground beef is evenly concealing the cheese stick.

Place the soon-to-be burger dogs on a hot grill. Grill for 6-10 minutes, turning the dogs when charred grill marks appear on a side. You’ll need to do 3-4 turns (or more) to make sure you have even cooking around each dog.
Burgers should be done when some cheese starts oozing out along with meat juice.
Serve on hot dog buns with your favorite burger or hot dog condiments.
Enjoy!

name: Cheese-stuffed Burger Dogs

description: These turkey burgers are super versatile! Serve on buns with all of the classic fixings, or sub in your own favorite flavors (sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and feta, anyone?). They also keep well in the fridge or freezer–make a double batch to keep on hand for easy protein to add to any meal!

instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, combine the turkey, panko, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, and mix with your hands until just evenly incorporated.
Divide the turkey mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into 4 patties.

Heat the canola oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the patties and cook, without moving, until browned, 3–4 minutes. Carefully flip the patties and continue cooking until the burgers are cooked through and golden brown, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C), 3–4 minutes more.
Serve the burgers on buns with ketchup, tomato, red onion, lettuce, and pickles, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Turkey Burgers

components.raw_text: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

compilations.description: Bored of eating the same old burgers? To excite your taste buds, we've compiled the perfect list of burger from all around the world. Travel to Mexico with the Chorizo burger and recreate the magic of Japan with the Shrimp Tempura burger. For us, the middle-eastern feta-stuffed falafel burgers was a definite winner!
compilations.name: Burgers From Around The World

description: This French Onion Burger is a savory twist on a classic burger, topped with caramelized onions, melted comte cheese, and a smear of tangy mustard. Served on a toasted bun, it's the perfect balance of juicy and flavorful.

instructions.display_text: Mix together the patty ingredients until evenly combined.
Form the beef into a round patty.
Repeat with the remaining beef.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, and place the slice of comté on top.
Cook for 6 more minutes.
Assemble the burgers on the buns with caramelized onions and arugula.
Enjoy!

name: French Onion Burger

compilations.name: 11 Fun Recipes For Your Next Girl's Night In
Indulging Snacks You'll Crave All Day Long
13 Mouth-Watering Recipes To Make With Your Friends

compilations.description: What better way to celebrate World Kindness Day than through delicious food! These recipes are super easy to make and are perfect for sharing. Start with the classic crowd pleasing Tear and Share Cinnamon Roll or with a super cheesy BBQ Cheeseburger Nachos. We promise you that these recipes will bring a smile on your loved ones. Make sure to keep your phone handy to capture the perfect moments!
compilations.name: Share The Smiles With These Delicious Meals

compilations.description: A great movie marathon is never complete without a big, delicious food spread – we know it, and it's time to make that dream a reality. There's a lot to choose from, but our favorite is definitely a classic with a twist – Pepperoni Pizza Dippers! If that's not enough, try these homemade Ice Cream Bites that'll be the perfect way to end your night. Ready for that Netflix binge? Well, your stomach certainly is.
compilations.name: Recipes For When You're Planning a Movie Marathon

compilations.description: No movie is ever complete without friends and fooood!! We're here to help you with food, test out the ultimate classic at every movie night - Buffalo Popcorn! Chase that down with Salami Sandwich, we bet that will send your tastebuds into a tizz! Are you ready for binge watch (and eating) sesh?!
compilations.name: Recipes For Your Next Movie Night!

compilations.description: March is here and that means so is a season of magnificent basketball! It’s time to get your brackets straight and cheer your heart out for your time. From Cheesy Chicken Nuggets to Fish & Chips, we are making sure that you get the perfect fuel for this action-packed season. Turn the game on, sit back on your couch and get yourself one of our tasty snacks!
compilations.name: Snacks for March Madness

description: A fun twist on classic nachos that features ground beef, cheese, and BBQ sauce on top of crispy tortilla chips.

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).

In a large pan or skillet, lay down half of the tortilla chips, followed by half of the ground beef, bbq sauce, cheddar, mozzarella, tomato, red onion, bacon, and parsley. Repeat with the remaining half of the ingredients, followed by a drizzle of BBQ sauce on top.
Bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.
Enjoy!

name: BBQ Cheeseburger Nachos

components.raw_text: 1 pound ground beef, cooked and drained

compilations.description: Bored of eating the same old burgers? To excite your taste buds, we've compiled the perfect list of burger from all around the world. Travel to Mexico with the Chorizo burger and recreate the magic of Japan with the Shrimp Tempura burger. For us, the middle-eastern feta-stuffed falafel burgers was a definite winner!
compilations.name: Burgers From Around The World

compilations.description: You might be able to travel right now, but with our selection of recipes, you won't feel like anything's missing. Spruce up your daily meals by trying things from all over the globe! For instance, start your day with a Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup and work your way up to a rich Fettuccine with Mussels. What better to way to get a taste of a different culture than right from your kitchen?
compilations.name: Recipes To Feel Like You Traveled The World

compilations.description: Whether you're cutting down on carbs or you follow a gluten free diet, you can still enjoy the pleasure of a delicious burger. Our Japanese-style fried chicken burger and shrimp tempura rice burger don't require bread and taste just as yummy on rice patties. For something classic, try this mason jar cornbread burger. In any case, a decadent burger doesn't require a bun. We'll help you get creative!
compilations.name: Bread-less Burger Recipes

compilations.description: Getting a table at your favorite restaurant on Valentine's Day is a heck of a task. This year, why not spend the day cooking a romantic meal to show your love? Your Valentine will undoubtedly be impressed. Start your day by whipping up these cute and delicious Valentine’s Day Pancakes. The Show-Stopping Beef Wellington would be ideal for a romantic dinner. End your day on a sweet note with Vanilla Crème Brûlée. The way to the heart is through the stomach, after all.
compilations.name: 21 Recipes to Cook For Your Valentine!

description: This burger is a healthy and flavorful option for burger lovers. The grilled salmon patty is glazed with a delicious teriyaki sauce, and served with fresh lettuce and tomato on a soft bun.

instructions.display_text: In a shallow bowl, stir together the soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. Add the salmon and marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add a splash of neutral oil. Add the marinated salmon and cook on both sides until cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add the reserved marinade to the pan. Stir until the salmon is fully coated in the glaze.
Shape the rice into four patties.
Heat another pan over medium-high heat and add the sesame oil. Add the rice “buns” and cook until the outside is crispy, about 5 minutes per side.
Top a rice bun with a piece of green leaf lettuce, half of the salmon fillet, a drizzle mayonnaise, and another rice bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients to make a second burger.
Enjoy!

name: Teriyaki Salmon Burger
